attributes.action: Don't make student nurses pay for their tuition
attributes.background: The country is built on its NHS and making nurses pay for their tuition will surely spell the end for this great service and stop thousands from taking up nursing. We need them and the NHS

attributes.action: Retractions of misleading media should be the same prominence as the original
attributes.background:
Highlighted by the Sun's front page article on Muslims support for Jihadi fighters. A retraction was ordered as the survey used was deliberately misleading, it was 'hidden' in a boring column of text titled 'Ispo ruling upheld'

Retractions should be equal prominence to original.
attributes.additional_details:
People have a right to know when they have been mislead, and clearly the majority who read the headline article will not have read the retraction.

Deliberately obscure retraction: https://pbs.twimg.com/media/CedPBYBWQAAtDs1.jpg

Original headline: https://vice-images.vice.com/images/articles/meta/2015/11/24/i-conducted-the-muslim-poll-the-sun-jihadi-sympathy-1448380391.png

attributes.action: Make disability awareness a regular thing taught in schools
attributes.background:
As a 14 yr old teenager with cerebral palsy who uses a wheelchair I know that bullying can be a regular thing for disabled people.

I believe that something needs to be done therefore we need to teach more young people about disability in order to reduce bullying and ultimately lack of awareness

attributes.action: Ban the use of Audible bird scarers
attributes.background: Ban the total use of bird scarers "gas cannon". These cannons are affecting the use and enjoyment of our homes and there is absolutely no legislation for something that affectively is a FIREARM. Our government needs to outright ban on them or closely legislate it

attributes.action: Have the part of the TV licence fee that goes to the BBC scrapped.
attributes.background: I feel it is wrong to be forced to fund an organisation that is complicit in the covering up of child abuse.

attributes.action: Phase out the minting of the 1p & 2p coin; the bane of our pockets, and lives.
attributes.background: It's worth a twelfth of it's value compared to 1971. There are 11.27 billion pennies, and 6.5 billion 2ps, nestled in commiseration in our receipts when at the shops. Traders complain of the cost of storage for such a mass. Is it still necessary for these copper cop-outs to burden our back pockets?

attributes.action: Abuse & Vandalism to UK War Graves & Monuments should carryBig Prison sentences.
attributes.background: It is now becoming common place for us to see Vandalism or Urination on Our Countries War Monuments & War Graves. It is Absolutely unacceptable! The Criminal/s involved have no respect or Morals. But they get nothing more than a Fine or Community service which is far to lenient for a Sentence.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/643407/urinate-World-War-One-memorial-cenotaph-vandal-St-Peters-square-Manchester-police

attributes.action: For the UK government to accept the UN findings on Julian Assange.
attributes.background:
United Nations findings;
Wikileaks founder Julian Assange has been arbitrarily detained by Sweden and the United Kingdom since his arrest in London on 7 December 2010, as a result of the legal action against him by both Governments.
attributes.additional_details:
In a public statement, the UN's expert panel called on the Swedish and British authorities to end Mr. Assange’s deprivation of liberty, respect his physical integrity and freedom of movement, and afford him the right to compensation.

The Working Group established that this detention violates Articles 9 and 10 of the Universal Declaration on Human Rights, and Articles 7, 9(1), 9(3), 9(4), 10 and 14 of the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights.

attributes.action: Give our police force better funding to prevent burglaries.
attributes.background: Within a week I have been inundated with messages saying that their van or their house has been broken into. Recently someone has spoken to police and they have said that not much can be done because they don't have the resources... Including funding! This Must Change!

attributes.action: Compel travel businesses  to stop charging extra costs for single travellers.
attributes.background: In the UK companies in the travel and holiday industries levy unreasonable extra costs in the single independant traveller.  The practice is to place unreasonable supplements while the provision often leads to substandard accommodation/facilities. This disallows fairness and equality.
attributes.additional_details: A single person, paid £2000 for a cruise.  She discovered during the cruise that a couple with a premium balcony outer cabin  paid the same costs.   The single person was consigned to an inner cabin deep within the ship.   A single person wished to travel with her family to Europe.  A well known holiday company operated a restrictive punitive policy insisting that the single traveller paid the cost comparable to a couple ie double the costs prejudicing fairness and equality.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of clothing trivialising suicide with distressing slogans or images
attributes.background: Amazon are offering t-shirts "making fun" of suicide with a variety of distressing slogans and images.  About 6,000 people end their lives by suicide every year.  The images are extremely distressing for people touched by suicide and they could provide a trigger for more suicides.
attributes.additional_details:
Suicide is the largest cause of death for men under 45.  The t-shirts, some aimed at children, have images of people hanging, the most common form of suicide.
Slogans include "Death is Gods way of saying you're fired. Suicide is humans way of saying I quit".
"Yesterday my brother committed suicide. Should I kill myself?".
"I ❤️ Suicide". We would never tolerate a slogan "I ❤️ Cancer".  
While the stigma remains for mental health we need to protect vulnerable people from seeing images like these.

attributes.action: Government to fund improved transport links in suburbs and estates
attributes.background: I live on Paxcroft Mead Housing Estate in Trowbridge, Wiltshire. In September 2015 we were cut off from our town as buses were cancelled. The same happened on the other side of town.
attributes.additional_details:
Responsible department: Department of Transportation
Action that could be taken includes setting up new bus links to outer areas of towns and cities.
People who cannot drive are unable to access town centres from outer suburbs since bus links are either not present or very expensive. Towns all over the country have this issue.

attributes.action: MPs who use private healthcare should be barred from voting on the NHS
attributes.background: MPs must declare whether they or their dependents use private healthcare. If they do, the MP should lose the right to speak or vote on any bills affecting the NHS. It is not right that MPs can impose laws on us that they can opt out of.

attributes.action: Childcare providers should be paid by direct payment
attributes.background: Parents/ Carers claiming the childcare element for childcare get paid into their accounts and then pass it on to their childcare provider. As a childcare provider I think it would be easier by paying the provider direct by the Inland Revenue.

attributes.action: All NHS employers to pay staff at least the living wage.
attributes.background: Some of the lowest paid NHS staff are working below the living wage. Please sign and support this petition

attributes.action: Require 75% turnout 60% majority for & 16+ voting in future   referendums
attributes.background: Less than 40% of UK Adults voted to for Brexit- a change that can't be reversed.  We must introduce a "triple lock" on future referendums about constitutional and irreversible changes.  The turn out must exceed 75%,  the majority in favour of change must exceed 60% and all those aged 16+ can vote

attributes.action: Erect a statue of Nigel Farage in the Parliament for UK Independance Day.
attributes.background: Nigel Farage dedicated his life to Britain's freedom. The exit from EU was only possible thanks to his decades long struggle against EU bureaucracy and him raising awareness. As a way to celebrate the man and his accomplishments we would like to erect a statue of himself in the Members' Lobby.

attributes.action: Introduce elections for selecting the UK Prime Minister
attributes.background:
An argument of the Brexit camp was that the EU does not reflect a democratic instutition. 

Standard practice is that the individual chosen to lead their political party is also the candidate for UK PM. The UK electorate should be able to cast a separate vote on who they feel should be PM.

attributes.action: Ban Smoking Except in Designated Areas
attributes.background:
There has been lots of scientific research done on passive smoking. It shows that passive smoking is just as bad as actually smoking. When someone is smoking nearby you're breathing in their smoke as well. 
Therefore smoking should be banned outside as well as inside except in designated areas.

attributes.action: Veto Turkey joining the EU until they cease their illegal occupation of Cyprus
attributes.background: In July 1974, Turkish forces twice invaded and captured the island of Cyprus and now illegally occupy 40% of it. Cyprus is a member of the EU and Turkey wish to join. Countries that occupy member states illegally cannot join the EU but Turkey will be allowed to unless it is vetoed.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkish_invasion_of_Cyprus

attributes.action: Introduce a social awareness lesson within the curriculum.
attributes.background: Bullying and discrimination within schools needs to be stopped. Let's introduce a social awareness lesson to allow youngsters the freedom of speech and allow them to talk about problems open and freely. Educate our youngsters the benefits of talking about problems and acceptance of other people.
attributes.additional_details: By educating youngsters about everyone is different and copes with things in different ways this will allow them to understand others behaviours and attitudes in situations. Mental health is vital within youngsters and allowing them to have a social skills lesson where they can talk about problems and understand that everyone battles life in different ways, and talk about their feelings and worries. Teaching our kids while still young will give them coping mechanisms to deal with different situations and teach them that bullying and discrimination is unacceptable and that not all illnesses/disabilities are visible.

attributes.action: Set up a Commission of Enquiry into the Bromley Housing Transfer of 1993
attributes.background: In 1993 Bromley Borough council tenants were given the unenviable task of choosing between a cash-strapped, cost-cutting council and privatisation of the entire housing stock, apparently for all time. This seems a peculiarly heavy democratic burden for any electorate to bear, especially the poor.

attributes.action: Taking TATA Steel pensioners money by changes to the law is immoral & wrong !!!
attributes.background:
All Pensioners not just TATA Steel pensioners are one of the lowest income areas in our society and to contemplate retrospective law changes after pensioners have signed a legally binding document is wrong and will undoubtably open the floodgates for ALL other businesses to follow.

STOP THIS NOW!
attributes.additional_details:
I strongly DO NOT support cutting pensioners money retrospectively.

If the Government changes the rules, there is nothing to stop ALL businesses doing the same should they find their pensions fund has a deficit.

What happens 3 or 5 or maybe 10 years down the line when the TATA Steel Works is in trouble again. Will the Government change the rules again to take EVEN more money off pensioners?

Its hard enough for Pensioners to live now .....
STOP THIS NOW BEFORE ITS YOUR TURN NEXT !!!

attributes.action: Retain passport/take fingerprints at point of entry to aid later identification.
attributes.background: Many foreigners making Visa entry to the UK to study, or for holidays, later break their Visa conditions, overstay and take work illegally.  If their Passports were retained, and they were given an authorised copy, to use whilst here, they could be easily identified via fingerprints and deported.

attributes.action: Remove VAT on investment silver coins and bars.
attributes.background:
Silver coins and bars are an accessible long term investment for many people. The application of VAT on silver is unfair. 

There is no VAT on investment gold coins and bars which favours wealthier investors. Some EU states do not charge VAT on silver bullion which gives them an unfair advantage.
attributes.additional_details:
Silver has been bought as a store of value for centuries. Most investments do not attract VAT for example stocks, shares, bonds, savings accounts, property and gold bullion.

1 Kilogram silver bars and 1oz silver Britannia coins are the most commonly purchased silver investments in the UK.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on Abolishing the Welsh Assembly
attributes.background: A petition was created during the last coalition government (2010-15) which was not widely publicised and gained only 3 signatures. The Welsh Assembly elections are about to take place and the "Abolish the Welsh Assembly Party" are encouraging people to sign a petition to call for a 3rd. referendum.
attributes.additional_details: You will find all the supporting material in the Assembly Election pamphlets that are pouring onto our door steps. This gives you all the persuasion you need to support this petition.

attributes.action: Change this petitions site to enable a motion to be voted FOR or AGAINST.
attributes.background: In parliament it is customary to conclude a vote with ayes to the right and nos to the left. It is therefore remarkable that e-committee members have not followed established convention by introducing a flawed system vulnerable to distortion according to the relative publicity given to a motion.
attributes.additional_details:
Every motion should have the option of a positive or negative vote as demonstrated by the recent Donald Trump issue where much press coverage was given to the ‘Ban Trump’ motion in contrast to the ‘Don’t ban Trump’ motion which was almost unknown due to minimal coverage.  

Whilst the e-petition system should enable members of parliament gain better understanding of the public opinion they are representing, it is fundamental that a conventional resilient and unbiased voting system be adopted.

attributes.action: Force food outlets to display a Capital H sign if they use Halal meat.
attributes.background:
Many food outlets are using and selling us Halal meat without our knowledge.
This meat has come from the barbaric practice of slitting the the animals throat without stunning them first. They are hung upside down and left to bleed to death. You deserve the right to know what you are eating.
attributes.additional_details: You should be able to clearly see if a food outlet is using Halal meat. You should be able to make an educated choice before buying.

attributes.action: Implement & enforce an improved code of professional conduct for MPs in session.
attributes.background:
Revise the MPs code of conduct to include:
Respect
Driving positive behaviours
Setting the example of professional conduct
Reinforcing to the public that MPs work for a shared goal, regardless of party allegiance
Presenting sessions of the British parliament in a positive light to the World
attributes.additional_details:
MPs have a duty and obligation to us, the electorate, to set the standards of positive British values.  Jeering, laughing, mocking, name calling, shouting etc would not be tolerated in day to day life and should not be accepted during sessions of parliament.  Many of these in fact constitute bullying.

A thorough reform of policy / conduct is required to improve behavior by those elected to represent us, with ongoing powers to enforce and hold those in breech to account.  Promote British Values.

attributes.action: Ban domesticated cats from being allowed to roam freely outdoors
attributes.background:
In 2014 there were estimated to be 8 million cats in Britain
It isn't natural for there to be 8 million cats roaming around this land. 
Cats kill 55 million birds a year, millions of other animals too, spread fleas, deficate on other peoples property and get ran over and cause accidents.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.pfma.org.uk/pet-population-2014
http://www.rspb.org.uk/makeahomeforwildlife/advice/gardening/unwantedvisitors/cats/birddeclines.aspx
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-19353/Cats-kill-275-million-animals-year.html

attributes.action: Require eCommerce and mail order companies to disclose their chosen courier.
attributes.background:
Currently the courier used is seen as a service offered to the seller however really it is just as much a service for the buyer.
Because the buyer has know knowledge of what courier will be used they are unable to avoid companies that have provided them with poor service in the past.
attributes.additional_details:
This results in a non-functioning market where prices are driven to low level by consumer demand for free delivery but there is no balance where demand for the services reduce due to poor service.
The simple market solution to this problem is to allow consumers to vote with their wallet by giving them the choice to not use couriers who provide them with a poor service.

attributes.action: Ban E-Cigarettes from indoor public areas and workplaces.
attributes.background: These devices are a nuisance, pollute the air, and are encouraging people to become addicted to nicotine. The advertising is showing these products as a trendy fashion accessory and "cool and sophisticated" to use. There are clear risks to people close by by passively inhaling the vapour.

attributes.action: Introduce Environmental Studies into the National school curriculum
attributes.background: With one of the hottest Winters on record it is ever more clear that our climate is changing, Affecting the environment. What can we do to prevent it? We must educate future generations on how to sustain a clean environment and the importance of energy conservation, consumption and waste management.
attributes.additional_details:
Data collected by NASA and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration showed that the global average temperature was 0.13C warmer than 2014. Meanwhile the UK's Met Office confirmed that 2015 was 0.75C warmer than the long-term average from 1961 to 1990. 

 In 2015, warming reached 1C above pre-Industrial levels for the first time. It's clear that the time we have left to prevent warming from reaching above 2C over pre-Industrial levels is ticking away.

Act before it is too late.

attributes.action: The government should implement a road tax on all adult cyclists. £40 per year
attributes.background: Cyclists use the road as much as car drivers do. In many cases cyclist show a marked lack of road sense and manners. They block many country roads so it is is only fair that they pay to use the roads. Displaying a valid road tax would reduce accidents and allow easy tracking of offenders

attributes.action: Uk government condemn Hong Kong government violate One country, two systems
attributes.background:
In 19 December 1984 the Sino-British Joint Declaration was signed by Prime Ministers Zhao Ziyang(PRC) and Margaret Thatcher (UK) , but nowadays in Hong Kong the Hong Kong government was 
violated One country, two systems policy and the Chinese government was intervene the political of Hong Kong .
attributes.additional_details: Hopefully, the UK government will condemn Hong Kong government violate One country, two systems.

attributes.action: Review PMQs to ensure it is progressive and effective
attributes.background:
The style and culture of PMQs has changed gradually over time...the now famous disorderly behaviour of MPs during PMQs first arose as a result of the personal animosity between Harold Wilson and Edward Heath; before this PMQs had been lively but comparatively civilised.
Wiki: https://goo.gl/fI43la
attributes.additional_details:
Formalities exist e.g. opposition leaders' right to ask questions. Other aspects need formality, e.g. behaviour. The style and culture of PMQs has indeed changed dramatically, see above. Its fame should not be used as an excuse for excusing behaviour that i) is abhorrent ii) prevents further questions iii) detracts from questions.
  The current format should be debated, past and present functions of it reviewed and a new progressive format to ensure a civil (yet lively) PMQs should emerge.

attributes.action: Gambling to face tighter regulations in advertising, use of credit cards & FOBT
attributes.background: Compulsive gambling is a cancer in this country. The government need to do more. Tobacco advertising was banned as it is a killer. So is gambling. Advertising should be banned, the use of credit cards to gamble must be banned and FOTB need to be outlawed. Stop it before more lives are ruined!
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/news/liverpool-news/dad-whose-gambling-addicted-son-10922618#ICID=sharebar_whatsapp

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3456358/Mesmerising-horror-watching-middle-class-accountant-lose-3-000-hour-crack-cocaine-gambling-machines.html?ito=whatsapp_share_mobile-top

Just two examples of lives being destroyed! My life has been ruined by gambling. I have wrecked my financial future & my family have left me. I take responsibility but more needs to be done to protect

attributes.action: Delay the date of the EU Referendum to allow as many people to vote as possible
attributes.background: The attempt to extend the franchise for the EU Referendum to 16 year-olds was unsuccessful, meaning thousands of young people and future voters will be denied a voice in this constitutionally significant referendum. By delaying the referendum, as many young people as possible will be able to vote.
attributes.additional_details: The Prime Minister himself has admitted that the likes of referendums like these only come around once every generation. It is the younger generations who will have to live with the outcome of this referendum for the majority of their lives, potentially all of it. I will turn 18 just 4 months after the referendum is rumoured to take place: denied a voice for the sake of 4 months. If the referendum were to be delayed until 2017, thousands more young people will have a say in their own future.

attributes.action: Provide a means for members of the public to present questions for PM Questions?
attributes.background:
This petitions site provides a means to make petitions and has thresholds of support (sponsors and signatories) before bothering parliament with them.

Can we have a system for asking questions directly to be asked at PM Questions in parliament, if the question has sufficient support?
attributes.additional_details:
It seems that a petition that asks the government to answers a simple questions is not considered a valid petition as it is not asking the government to actually do something.

This is odd, as "answer a question" is, in my opinion, "doing something", so clearly this system is not good for questions. Asking you MP is hit and miss, so a system to allow this with say 1,000 supporting signatories, would be useful.

Please can we have such a system?

attributes.action: Urge David Cameron to visit the Calais refugee camp and respond to the crisis.
attributes.background: On 27th January 2016 during Prime Minister's Questions, Rt Hon David Cameron MP described the residents of the refugee camp at Calais as a "bunch of migrants". The undersigned urge MPs to insist that Mr Cameron visits the camp personally and that Parliament hold a debate on solutions on his return.

attributes.action: Instigate a 2nd EU referendum, honestly campaigned and to include 16-17 yr olds
attributes.background:
EU Membership is too important to be decided by a vote based on inaccurate campaign claims and which excluded 16-17yr olds.
The EU referendum result is not legally binding. Cameron decided that the UK should be bound by it but has subsequently resigned. His decision can & should be rescinded.
attributes.additional_details:
•	The percentage difference between Leave and Remain was not great enough to trigger such a momentous course of action - 48% voted Remain 
•	16 & 17yr olds were not included - their future is at stake & their votes should be counted
•	Voters may have been swayed by false information - eg the Leave campaigners have acknowledged their NHS claims were inaccurate. All campaign claims should be regulated by the Advertising Standards Authority to ensure accuracy and honesty for both parties.

attributes.action: Impose a tuition fee cap for international students
attributes.background: The fees for Home/EU students are controlled by the UK Government; however, there isn't a cap for the international students. Institutions may charge international students up to 3 times the Home/EU fees. In addition, institutions may continue to raise the tuition fees. This should be capped.

attributes.action: Local Council Register all fitness professionals that can practice legitimately
attributes.background: Currently there is no regulation of non qualified fitness professionals from practising without qualifications and insurance. To maintain standards a register of all trading fitness/massage persons working/earning should be controlled by local councils. REPS and CIMSPA can only regulate upon members
attributes.additional_details: Poor quality and lack of knowledge isn't the way forward to providing good exercise prescription. This just simply isn't safe if you are charging the client or giving it for free. If you have no qualifications/experience you can mislead people into thinking you can training healthy people or people with diagnosed medical conditions or injuries or even have no insurance. We must raise the standard of what clients have as a fitness professional and impose some kind of penalty.

attributes.action: British Isles devolution to allow regions to choose RemaIN in the EU or Leave.
attributes.background: Mainland Denmark is in the EU, whilst devolved Greenland and Faroe Islands are in Denmark but not in the EU. Great Britain and Northern Ireland are in the UK and therefore the EU, while the Isles of Jersey, Guernsey and Man are in the British Isles but not in the UK or the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
Areas of England and Wales that wish to leave the EU, could devolve out of the UK (and therefore the EU), whilst remaining in the Kingdom of the British Isles. We would all still be British citizens under the Queen and sovereign parliament in Westminster. 
London, NI and Scotland could remain in the EU.
This would be cheaper, simpler, more flexible and quicker than Brexit.
We request that the UK government hold a referendum on all realistic options for the relationship between the UK and the EU.

attributes.action: Empty black bins once a week in summer and hot spells.
attributes.background: I, like many others suffer during the summer and sometimes other seasons  with fly and maggots in my black bin, even though I have it cleaned after every empty. I think the government should force councils to empty the black bins once a week during hot spells to reduce this.

attributes.action: Don't rush Brexit: invoke Article 50 after the next general election in 2020.
attributes.background:
The government carried out it's promise to have a referendum; it was not elected to exit the European Union. 

Exiting the European Union is a massive undertaking, and requires planning, strong leadership and clear vision.

For the Brexit to succeed, we need a government elected for the purpose.
attributes.additional_details:
Points to consider from the Conservative Manifesto:
"Our commitment to you:
keep our economy secure by running a surplus so that we start paying down our debts."
"We will use our membership of ...the
EU [amongst other organisations]...to achieve the best for Britain."
"We want an EU that helps Britain move ahead..."
"The Conservative Party is the party of the Union
– and we will always do our utmost to keep our family
of nations together."

attributes.action: Control the right to vote, by a political knowledge test.
attributes.background:
Voters have no political knowledge to vote fairly.
It is a duty of every voter to know the theory behind every voting and base the opinion and vote on true facts and figures. 
To help the nation understand the politics and consequences of choices, 'right to vote' control is urgently needed.

attributes.action: Reject any Brexit terms that exclude the UK from the Common Market
attributes.background: This petition requires that before invoking Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty, HM Government must ensure that, following Brexit, British citizens and firms will continue to have full, unprejudiced access to the European Economic Area.

attributes.action: The World Heritage City of Bath Should Remain within the EU and leave the UK
attributes.background: The UK has voted to leave the EU after 43 years. A 57.9% majority of Bath residents voted to remain. There was a turnout of 105,298 in Bath & NE Somerset, that's 77.13%. 60,878 of residents voted to remain. We are a World Heritage City. We want to remain and share that heritage with Europe.

attributes.action: Call for a UK referendum on the abolition of the "unelected" UK monarchy.
attributes.background: We have elected to leave the EU. One of the many arguments for the case of the UK leaving was to disconnect ourselves from the influence of unelected officials making choices on our behalf. So why stop with the EU? Let us now have a referendum on the relevance of the monarchy in our new modern UK.
